snippet: Very slight differences in a family of genes regulating spiciness in wild mustard plants determine not only the degree of heat but also a plant’s prospects of survival.
abstract: Study in journal Science finds that the small family of genes that regulates the spiciness of mustard plants also influences the production of enzymes that deter insects.
lead_paragraph: Very slight differences in a family of genes regulating spiciness in wild mustard plants determine not only the degree of heat but also a plant’s prospects of survival.
